pred_ans_conf_NL_MCQ: The pawns.I'm absolutely certain that the answer is correct, as 'en passant' is a special pawn capture in chess that allows the pawn to capture an enemy pawn "en passant" (i.e., as if it had moved two squares instead of one) if the enemy pawn has only moved two squares forward from its starting position, and if the pawn capturing it would have been able to capture it if it had only moved two squares
